001package com.randomnoun.maven.plugin.swaggerCombine;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.FileInputStream;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.io.InputStream;
007import java.io.InputStreamReader;
008import java.io.Reader;
009import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;
010import java.io.Writer;
011import java.net.URLDecoder;
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.Arrays;
014import java.util.Collections;
015import java.util.HashMap;
016import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Map;
019import java.util.Set;
020import java.util.function.IntConsumer;
021
022import org.apache.maven.plugin.logging.Log;
023import org.apache.maven.shared.utils.io.FileUtils.FilterWrapper;
024import org.yaml.snakeyaml.Yaml;
025
026import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;
027import com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat.yaml.YAMLFactory;
028import com.fasterxml.jackson.dataformat.yaml.YAMLGenerator;
029
030public class SwaggerCombiner {
031
032        public List<FilterWrapper> getFilterWrappers() {
033                return filterWrappers;
034        }
035
036        public void setFilterWrappers(List<FilterWrapper> filterWrappers) {
037                this.filterWrappers = filterWrappers;
038        }
039
040        File relativeDir;
041        String[] files;
042        boolean verbose;
043        Log log;
044        List<FilterWrapper> filterWrappers;
045
046        private Map<String, Map<String, Object>> yamlFiles = new HashMap<String, Map<String, Object>>();
047
048        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
049        public void combine(Writer w) throws IOException {
050
051                List<String> fileList = new ArrayList<String>(Arrays.asList(files));
052                Collections.sort(fileList);
053                
054                Yaml yaml = new Yaml();
055                @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
056                Map mergedObj = null;
057                for (String f : fileList) {
058                        InputStream inputStream = new FileInputStream(new File(relativeDir, f));
059                        Reader reader = new InputStreamReader(inputStream);
060                        if (filterWrappers != null) {
061                                for ( FilterWrapper wrapper : filterWrappers ) {
062                    reader = wrapper.getReader( reader );
063                }
064                        }
065                        
066                        @SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
067                        Map obj = yaml.load(reader);
068                        if (mergedObj == null) {
069                                mergedObj = obj;
070                        } else {
071                                merge(mergedObj, obj, f, "");
072                        }
073                }
074                // going to use $xref instead of $ref since my ref syntax is a bit different
075                // and to make it more obvious that this isn't a valid swagger file
076
077                // this is definitely a constructive use of my weekend
078                replaceRefs((Map<Object, Object>) mergedObj, relativeDir, "");
079
080                final ObjectMapper mapper = new ObjectMapper(
081                        new YAMLFactory().configure(YAMLGenerator.Feature.MINIMIZE_QUOTES, true)
082                                .configure(YAMLGenerator.Feature.SPLIT_LINES, false)
083                                .configure(YAMLGenerator.Feature.ALWAYS_QUOTE_NUMBERS_AS_STRINGS, true));
084                configureMapper(mapper);
085                mapper.writeValue(w, mergedObj);
086                w.flush();
087        }
088
089        @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked" })
090        private void merge(Map<Object, Object> mergedObj, Map<Object, Object> obj, String f, String prefix)
091                        throws IllegalArgumentException {
092                Set<Object> cloneSet = new LinkedHashSet<Object>(obj.keySet());
093                for (Object k : cloneSet) {
094                        Object v = obj.get(k);
095                        Object mv = mergedObj.get(k);
096
097                        if (mv == null) {
098                                // simple merge
099                                mergedObj.put(k, v);
100                        } else if (v == null) {
101                                // nothing to merge
102                        } else if (mv instanceof Map && v instanceof Map) {
103                                // the only things we can merge are maps
104                                merge((Map<Object, Object>) mv, (Map<Object, Object>) v, f, prefix + String.valueOf(k) + "/");
105                        } else if (mv.getClass().equals(v.getClass())) {
106                                // replace if the types are the same
107                                mergedObj.put(k, v);
108                        } else {
109                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Could not merge " + f + "#" + prefix + String.valueOf(k) + 
110                                        " (" + v.getClass().getName() + ") into merged object " + mv.getClass().getName());
111                        }
112                }
113        }
114
115        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
116        private Object replaceRefs(Map<Object, Object> obj, File relativeDir, String spacePrefix)
117                        throws IllegalArgumentException, IOException {
118                // process $xref before other keys
119                Object result = null;
120                if (obj.containsKey("$xref")) {
121                        Object xref = obj.get("$xref");
122                        if (verbose) {
123                                getLog().info(spacePrefix + "$xref to " + xref);
124                        }
125                        result = getXref(relativeDir, (String) xref);
126                        if (result instanceof Map) {
127                                // shallow clone, but replaceRefs will perform shallow clones at deeper levels
128                                result = new HashMap<Object, Object>((Map<Object, Object>) result);
129                                result = replaceRefs((Map<Object, Object>) result, relativeDir, spacePrefix + "  ");
130                        }
131
132                        // override values in xref object
133                        for (Object k : obj.keySet()) {
134                                Object v = obj.get(k);
135                                if (k.equals("$xref")) {
136                                        // ignore
137                                } else {
138                                        if (verbose) {
139                                                getLog().info(spacePrefix + String.valueOf(k));
140                                        }
141                                        if (result instanceof Map) {
142                                                Map<Object, Object> r = (Map<Object, Object>) result;
143                                                if (r.get(k) == null) {
144                                                        // add new property to xref'ed Map
145                                                        r.put(k, v);
146                                                } else if (r.get(k) instanceof Map && v instanceof Map) {
147                                                        // the xref'ed object is a Map containing a Map
148                                                        // don't think this is ever going to happen. but maybe it will
149                                                        Map<Object, Object> rv = (Map<Object, Object>) r.get(k);
150                                                        merge(rv, (Map<Object, Object>) v, "", String.valueOf(k) + "/");
151                                                } else {
152                                                        // replace existing key/value pair
153                                                        r.put(k, v);
154                                                }
155                                        } else {
156                                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
157                                                        "Could not override " + String.valueOf(k) + " (" + v.getClass().getName() +
158                                                        ") from xref '" + xref + "' " + result.getClass().getName());
159                                        }
160                                }
161                        }
162
163                } else {
164                        // descend into obj
165                        // clone to prevent ConcurrentModificationException
166                        Set<Object> cloneSet = new LinkedHashSet<Object>(obj.keySet());
167                        for (Object k : cloneSet) {
168                                Object v = obj.get(k);
169                                if (k.equals("$xref")) {
170                                        throw new IllegalStateException("$xref found in Map that didn't contain $xref");
171                                } else if (verbose) {
172                                        getLog().info(spacePrefix + String.valueOf(k));
173                                }
174                                if (v instanceof Map) {
175                                        // shallow clone, but replaceRefs will perform shallow clones at deeper levels
176                                        Map<Object, Object> clone = new HashMap<Object, Object>((Map<Object, Object>) v);
177                                        Object newObject = replaceRefs(clone, relativeDir, spacePrefix + "  ");
178                                        obj.put(k, newObject);
179                                }
180                        }
181                        result = obj;
182                }
183
184                return result;
185        }
186
187        private Object getXref(File relativeDir, String ref) throws IllegalArgumentException, IOException {
188                // myproject-v1-object.yaml#/definitions/InvalidResponse       existing
189                // myproject-v1-swagger-api.yaml#/paths/~1authenticate         the JSON-Pointer way
190                // myproject-v1-swagger-api.yaml#/paths/%2Fauthenticate        the url escape way
191                // myproject-v1-swagger-api.yaml#/paths/#/authenticate         the randomnoun way.
192
193                // can't have '#' as the start of a key as that's a comment. but you probably can. somehow.
194                int pos = ref.indexOf('#');
195                if (pos == -1) {
196                        // local refs still start with a '#'
197                        // $ref: '#/paths/~1blogs~1{blog_id}~1new~0posts'
198                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unparseable $xref '" + ref + "'");
199                } else {
200                        String f = ref.substring(0, pos);
201                        String p = ref.substring(pos + 1);
202                        // any remaining '#' chars switch between ~1-style escaping and no escaping
203                        // see ResolverCache or the json-pointer escaping rules in swagger
204                        final StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
205                        p.chars().forEachOrdered(new IntConsumer() {
206                                boolean asJsonPath = true;
207
208                                @Override
209                                public void accept(int ch) {
210                                        if (ch == '#') {
211                                                asJsonPath = !asJsonPath;
212                                        } else if (asJsonPath) {
213                                                result.append((char) ch);
214                                        } else {
215                                                // escape this jsonpath-ly
216                                                if (ch == '/') {
217                                                        result.append("~1");
218                                                } else if (ch == '~') {
219                                                        result.append("~0");
220                                                } else {
221                                                        result.append((char) ch);
222                                                }
223                                        }
224                                }
225                        });
226                        ref = f + "#" + result.toString();
227
228                        // as per ResolverCache
229                        // although ResolverCache parses an entire json doc every time there's a ref,
230                        // even if we've already parsed it.
231                        final String[] refParts = ref.split("#/");
232                        final String file = refParts[0];
233                        final String definitionPath = refParts.length == 2 ? refParts[1] : null;
234                        Map<String, Object> contents = yamlFiles.get(file);
235                        if (contents == null) {
236                                Yaml yaml = new Yaml();
237                                File inputFile = new File(relativeDir, file);
238                                InputStream inputStream = new FileInputStream(inputFile);
239                                try {
240                                        contents = yaml.load(inputStream);
241                                } catch (Exception e) {
242                                        throw new IOException("Invalid YAML file '" + inputFile.getCanonicalPath() + "'", e);
243                                }
244                                inputStream.close();
245                                yamlFiles.put(file, contents);
246                        }
247                        if (verbose) {
248                                getLog().info("definitionPath '" + definitionPath + "' in '" + file + "'");
249                        }
250                        if (definitionPath == null) {
251                                return contents;
252                        } else {
253                                String[] jsonPathElements = definitionPath.split("/");
254                                Object node = contents;
255                                for (String jsonPathElement : jsonPathElements) {
256                                        try {
257                                                node = ((Map<?, ?>) node).get(unescapePointer(jsonPathElement));
258                                                if (node == null) {
259                                                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
260                                                                        "Could not find " + definitionPath + " in contents of " + file);
261                                                }
262                                        } catch (ClassCastException cce) {
263                                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Could not descend into " + jsonPathElement + " of "
264                                                                + definitionPath + " in contents of " + file);
265                                        }
266                                        // getLog().info("jsonPathElement is " + node);
267                                }
268                                return node;
269                        }
270                }
271        }
272
273        // ResolverCache.unescapePointer()
274        private String unescapePointer(String jsonPathElement) {
275                // URL decode the fragment
276                try {
277                        jsonPathElement = URLDecoder.decode(jsonPathElement, "UTF-8");
278                } catch (UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
279                        //
280                }
281                // Unescape the JSON Pointer segment using the algorithm described in RFC 6901,
282                // section 4:
283                // https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901#section-4
284                // First transform any occurrence of the sequence '~1' to '/'
285                jsonPathElement = jsonPathElement.replaceAll("~1", "/");
286                // Then transforming any occurrence of the sequence '~0' to '~'.
287                return jsonPathElement.replaceAll("~0", "~");
288        }
289
290        // from io.swagger.codegen.languages.SwaggerYamlGenerator
291        // but hopefully not requires as we're only dealing with structured lists/maps,
292        // not Swagger objects
293        private void configureMapper(ObjectMapper mapper) {
294                /*
295                 * Module deserializerModule = new DeserializationModule(true, true);
296                 * mapper.registerModule(deserializerModule);
297                 * mapper.setSerializationInclusion(JsonInclude.Include.NON_NULL);
298                 * mapper.configure(SerializationFeature.FAIL_ON_EMPTY_BEANS, false);
299                 * mapper.configure(SerializationFeature.WRITE_DATES_AS_TIMESTAMPS, false);
300                 * mapper.configure(DeserializationFeature.FAIL_ON_UNKNOWN_PROPERTIES, false);
301                 * mapper.addMixIn(Response.class, ResponseSchemaMixin.class);
302                 * ReferenceSerializationConfigurer.serializeAsComputedRef(mapper);
303                 */
304        }
305
306        public File getRelativeDir() {
307                return relativeDir;
308        }
309
310        public void setRelativeDir(File relativeDir) {
311                this.relativeDir = relativeDir;
312        }
313
314        public String[] getFiles() {
315                return files;
316        }
317
318        public void setFiles(String[] files) {
319                this.files = files;
320        }
321
322        public boolean isVerbose() {
323                return verbose;
324        }
325
326        public void setVerbose(boolean verbose) {
327                this.verbose = verbose;
328        }
329
330        public Log getLog() {
331                return log;
332        }
333
334        public void setLog(Log log) {
335                this.log = log;
336        }
337
338
339}
